name: She's on the Money | Victoria Devine

episodes.title: Potential Cult Vibes: What to Do When a Loved One Is Caught Up in Something Sketchy
episodes.description:
This week’s dilemma hits close to home. A listener’s brother has thrown himself into a self-development program called Landmark, spending thousands and encouraging the rest of the family to do the same—offering to even cover part of the cost. The catch? It’s giving off major MLM and cult-like vibes.

Our listener’s sister has already signed up despite being unable to afford it, and the whole situation feels uncomfortable and coercive. In this episode, Victoria and Jess break down what Landmark actually is, why it’s so controversial, and how to navigate the complex emotional dynamics when family is involved.

We unpack:

What Landmark and other LGATs (Large Group Awareness Trainings) actually are

The red flags to look out for in these programs

Whether Landmark is technically an MLM—or something even more intense

The fine line between offering support and setting boundaries

Advice from the community, including past participants and those who’ve tried to intervene

This one’s a mix of real talk, financial caution, and emotional support—because sometimes protecting your money means protecting your peace, even from those closest to you.

Have you ever felt pressured to join something that didn’t sit right with you? Let us know in the comments.
https://www.shesonthemoney.com.au/links

The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances. She's On The Money exists purely for educational purposes and should not be relied upon to make an investment or financial decision. If you do choose to buy a financial product, read the PDS, TMD and obtain appropriate financial advice tailored towards your needs.
